title: Live updates: Death toll rises to 31 in Israeli strike that killed 2 Hezbollah commanders in Beirut
content: The deaths of Ibrahim Aqil and Ahmed Wehbe were confirmed Friday. It was the first time two Hezbollah commanders had been killed by Israel in single day.
summary: The deaths of Ibrahim Aqil and Ahmed Wehbe were confirmed Friday. It was the first time two Hezbollah commanders had been killed by Israel in single day.

title: Israel says it will press on against Hezbollah amid calls for restraint
What to know about Hezbollah, the group targeted by Israel in Lebanon
content: Hezbollah is one of the most powerful militant groups in the Middle East, a major political and social force in Lebanon, and a decades-long opponent of Israel.
summary: Hezbollah is one of the most powerful militant groups in the Middle East, a major political and social force in Lebanon, and a decades-long opponent of Israel.

title: At U.N. Security Council meeting, members urge restraint in escalating conflict

Sri Lanka votes in first election since financial meltdown
content: More than three dozen candidates are vying to lead Sri Lanka out of an economic collapse that led to the 2022 ouster of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.
summary: More than three dozen candidates are vying to lead Sri Lanka out of an economic collapse that led to the 2022 ouster of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

title: Zelensky to appeal to Biden’s legacy in plea to lift Ukraine weapon limits
content: Zelensky said he also expects to meet Democratic presidential candidate Vice President Kamala Harris and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.
summary: Zelensky said he also expects to meet Democratic presidential candidate Vice President Kamala Harris and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.

title: Israel kills senior Hezbollah commander in strike on Beirut suburb
content: Hezbollah confirmed that senior leader Ibrahim Aqil was killed in the strike, which capped a bloody week of attacks across Lebanon amid fears of a wider war.
summary: Hezbollah confirmed that senior leader Ibrahim Aqil was killed in the strike, which capped a bloody week of attacks across Lebanon amid fears of a wider war.

title: Israel’s pager attack an intelligence triumph, with uncertain ends
content: After Israel turned Hezbollah’s communications system against it with deadly force, officials and experts wonder if a bigger war is coming.
summary: After Israel turned Hezbollah’s communications system against it with deadly force, officials and experts wonder if a bigger war is coming.

title: Who was Ibrahim Aqil, the Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike?
Israel targets senior Hezbollah commander in Beirut suburb
Major Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike, militant group says
content: The strike on a suburb of Lebanon’s capital killed Ibrahim Aqil, a prominent Hezbollah leader, and other senior commanders, Israel said. The attack left 14 people dead.
summary: The strike on a suburb of Lebanon’s capital killed Ibrahim Aqil, a prominent Hezbollah leader, and other senior commanders, Israel said. The attack left 14 people dead.

title: Who was Ibrahim Aqil, the Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike?
content: Aqil was a Hezbollah leader who sat on the group’s military council. He was wanted by the U.S. government for organizing a spate of bombings in the 1980s.
summary: Aqil was a Hezbollah leader who sat on the group’s military council. He was wanted by the U.S. government for organizing a spate of bombings in the 1980s.

title: Israeli forces shove at least four men off West Bank roof, videos show
content: The Israel Defense Forces are investigating the episode, which it said went against “IDF values.” The United States has called for an investigation.
summary: The Israel Defense Forces are investigating the episode, which it said went against “IDF values.” The United States has called for an investigation.

title: Washington and the West struggle for a way forward with Putin’s Russia
content: In the United States and Europe, there is growing uncertainty about how to counter Putin’s aggression without stoking a direct conflict with Russia.

title: Hezbollah chief calls pager, radio attacks an ‘act of war’ by Israel

A key question behind Israeli attack on Hezbollah devices: Why now?
A broader Israel-Lebanon war now seems inevitable
content: This week’s pager explosions in Lebanon represent a tactical victory for Israel. They also appear likely to lock the region into an escalatory spiral.
summary: This week’s pager explosions in Lebanon represent a tactical victory for Israel. They also appear likely to lock the region into an escalatory spiral.

title: Israel’s clash with Hezbollah strains U.S. effort to prevent wider war
content: The absence of a full-blown war in Lebanon has been touted as a core U.S. achievement, but now Washington’s grip on the crisis appears more tenuous than ever.
summary: The absence of a full-blown war in Lebanon has been touted as a core U.S. achievement, but now Washington’s grip on the crisis appears more tenuous than ever.

title: Exploding pager attacks in Lebanon, and fears of a wider war
content: Hezbollah’s leader called two days of deadly blasts in Lebanon this week an “act of war” by Israel. Today, on “Post Reports,” what we know about how the attacks unfolded – and whether they could escalate to all-out war.
summary: Hezbollah’s leader called two days of deadly blasts in Lebanon this week an “act of war” by Israel. Today, on “Post Reports,” what we know about how the attacks unfolded – and whether they could escalate to all-out war.

title: Toll of Lebanon device attacks reveals Hezbollah’s ‘society in arms’
content: The attacks offer a rare window into the inner workings of Hezbollah — an organization that is notoriously secretive and deeply embedded in Lebanese society.
summary: The attacks offer a rare window into the inner workings of Hezbollah — an organization that is notoriously secretive and deeply embedded in Lebanese society.

title: Hezbollah chief calls pager, radio attacks an ‘act of war’ by Israel
content: Hezbollah leader Hasan Nasrallah addressed the nation Thursday in a televised speech, as Israeli warplanes flew over the Lebanese capital, Beirut.
summary: Hezbollah leader Hasan Nasrallah addressed the nation Thursday in a televised speech, as Israeli warplanes flew over the Lebanese capital, Beirut.

title: Japanese walkie-talkie maker investigating Lebanon explosion reports
content: Icom says the two-way radios apparently used in deadly attacks across Lebanon were discontinued a decade ago.
summary: Icom says the two-way radios apparently used in deadly attacks across Lebanon were discontinued a decade ago.

title: Portugal wracked by blazes at tail end of Europe’s wildfire season
content: Three firefighters died battling the blazes, Portugal’s prime minister said, adding the country was going through “difficult days.”
summary: Three firefighters died battling the blazes, Portugal’s prime minister said, adding the country was going through “difficult days.”

title: Sword with pharaoh’s mark found in Egypt, still shimmering 3,000 years later
content: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.
summary: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.

title: Woman spends almost two hours in 13-foot python’s coils: ‘I fought with it’
content: Thai rescue workers freed the woman, who had been washing dishes at home when she was trapped by the 13-foot python. She was bitten several times.
summary: Thai rescue workers freed the woman, who had been washing dishes at home when she was trapped by the 13-foot python. She was bitten several times.
